Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libnm-gtk
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: network-manager-applet bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The GNOME network‑manager‑applet serves for managing network connections and interacting with the NetworkManager. This update fixes the following bugs: Due to an error in the underlying code, the Save button stayed disabled after selecting the device's media access control (MAC) address when adding an InfiniBand interface to the Network Connections GUI. To fix this bug, the code has been replaced. As a result, the Save button is now enabled. (BZ#1182560) Previously, the Data Center Bridging (DCB) tab on the NETWORK & HOSTNAME screen that appears during Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.0 installation was not translated into Japanese, and in the Japanese version of the system, it incorrectly displayed in English. This could cause problems to some Japanese users. To fix this bug, Japanese translation of the tab content has been added. (BZ#1081943) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: The nm‑connection‑editor now allows the creation of bond, team, and bridge connections without slave or port connections. (BZ#1075198) Users of network-manager-applet are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
